fontTrends.name: Inter
fontTrends.description: A free, open-source neo-grotesque sans-serif typeface designed by Rasmus Andersson, optimized for on-screen readability, especially at small sizes. It includes a wide range of OpenType features and supports over 140 languages.
fontTrends.exampleUse: Widely used in applications and websites, including GitLab, ISO, Mozilla, NASA, and Zurich Airport.

fontTrends.name: Roboto
fontTrends.description: Developed by Google, Roboto is a versatile sans-serif typeface with a geometric structure and slightly rounded edges, offering a modern and friendly feel. It has a broad range of weights and styles, making it suitable for various applications.
fontTrends.exampleUse: Utilized in Google Workspace, including Google Docs and Google Analytics, ensuring a consistent and polished look.

fontTrends.name: Satoshi
fontTrends.description: A minimalist and open-source typeface with a geometric design and clean lines, offering excellent readability even at small sizes. Its neutral style allows it to adapt to various themes and design purposes.
fontTrends.exampleUse: Ideal for modern web design, particularly in tech-driven platforms.

fontTrends.name: Overpass
fontTrends.description: A geometric sans-serif typeface derived from Highway Gothic, designed for web use with a focus on digital screens for user interfaces and websites. It comprises 18 variants, including 9 font weights and corrected obliques for each weight.
fontTrends.exampleUse: Commissioned by Red Hat for use in their software for UI elements.

fontTrends.name: Montserrat
fontTrends.description: A geometric sans-serif typeface inspired by the signage of Buenos Aires, featuring a large x-height, short descenders, and wide apertures, achieving high legibility even in small sizes.
fontTrends.exampleUse: Used on over 19 million websites, including portfolios, blogs, and SaaS platforms.

colorTrends.name: Vibrant Blues
colorTrends.description: A deep, rich blue that conveys trust and professionalism, commonly used in SaaS and startup landing pages to establish credibility.

colorTrends.name: Soft Greens
colorTrends.description: A calming green that suggests growth and stability, often paired with blues to create a harmonious and inviting design.

colorTrends.name: Warm Neutrals
colorTrends.description: Light, neutral tones that provide a clean and unobtrusive backdrop, allowing other design elements to stand out.

colorTrends.name: Accent Oranges
colorTrends.description: A vibrant orange used sparingly to draw attention to key calls to action or important information.

colorTrends.name: Muted Purples
colorTrends.description: A sophisticated purple that adds a touch of elegance and is often used for highlighting features or premium offerings.

designNotes: Minimalism continues to dominate UI design, focusing on clean layouts and intuitive navigation.
Brutalism is emerging as a counter-trend, with raw, unpolished designs that challenge traditional aesthetics.
Gradients are making a comeback, adding depth and dimension to interfaces, often used subtly to enhance visual interest.
Dark mode interfaces are gaining popularity, providing a sleek and modern user experience while reducing eye strain.
Microinteractions are being integrated to provide feedback and enhance user engagement, making interfaces feel more responsive and dynamic.
